com.delphix.masking.api.plugin

Interface MaskingBatch<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of values contained in the batch
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    RunnableBatch

    public interface MaskingBatch<T>
    This class stores a set of values to be masked, and is the input type to the MaskingAlgorithm.maskBatch(com.delphix.masking.api.plugin.MaskingBatch<T>) method. The type paramter T must correspond with one of the classes mentioned in MaskingAlgorithm.MaskingType

    Batch masking typically proceeds as follows:

    • Determine the size of the batch using size().
    • Extract each value to be masked by calling getValue(int) with index values from 0 to (size - 1).
    • Mask all values in the batch.
    • Add each masked result to the batch by calling setValue(int, T) with index values from 0 to (size - 1).
    • Indicate errors masking any particular value by calling setValue(int, T) passing the value index and the error that occurred
    Since:
    1.5.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T getValue(int index)
      Get the value to be masked at a particular index from the batch.
      void setError(int index, MaskingException e)
      Set the error that occurred when masking a particular item in a batch.
      void setValue(int index, T value)
      Set the masking result at a particular index in the batch.
      int size()
      Get the size of the batch.

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        @Nullable
T getValue(int index)
        Get the value to be masked at a particular index from the batch.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the value to get, in the range of 0 to size - 1
        Returns:
        The value to be masked

      • setValue

        void setValue(int index,
              @Nullable
              T value)
        Set the masking result at a particular index in the batch.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the value to set, in the range of 0 to size - 1
        value - The masked value

      • setError

        void setError(int index,
              @Nonnull
              MaskingException e)
        Set the error that occurred when masking a particular item in a batch. All value-specific masking errors should be reported using this method rather throwing an exception directly from MaskingAlgorithm.maskBatch(com.delphix.masking.api.plugin.MaskingBatch<T>).
        Parameters:
        index - The index of value that was being masked when the error occurred, in the range of 0 to size - 1
        e - The error that occurred.

      • size

        int size()
        Get the size of the batch.
        Returns:
        The size of the batch
